page.title: 07Stibbard Village Hall
page.content: The hall was built in 1934 and is run by a small committee. It is hired frequently by many village groups - the Womens Institute, the Friendship Club for the over-sixties, and a weekly Folk Dance Group. Parish Council Meetings are held there, and the Stibbard Players use it for rehearsals and their two annual performances. A Junior Drama group also meets and performs there. Villagers celebrate their Silver Weddings in the hall or hold their Christening Parties there. The school used the hall for two years for physical education, until suitable space was provided at the school itself. For three years an annual party of schoolboy pilgrims on its way to Walsingham Shrine has spent a night in sleeping bags on the hall floor.
